stories.text:
Aside from HN, do you visit other forums?

I used to think traditional forums were completely dead, but after getting into working on cars I am frequently on both https://www.tacomaworld.com and https://www.e46fanatics.com

Interested to see if others hang out on SW forums or other hobbies.
stories.title: Ask HN: What other forums do you visit?

Coinbase grapples with internal crisis as 1,100 employees laid off
New Vector Podcast Episode: Search Embeddings and Mighty
First look: New state-of-the-art firefighting aircraft ready for action
Redfin and Compass lay off a combined 900 as mortgage interest rates climb

stories.text:
I’ve been asked recently by a buddy who’s kid (13) wants to learn programming but isn’t sure where is best to start. My gut feeling is something like Python might make the most sense, but wanted to ask the room.

Criteria I’m working on are:

1) Ease to get to “Hello World”.

2) Kid-friendly, easily available learning resources.

3) Low setup complexity.

It’s been so long since I’ve been there (VB6!) that it’s harder to know in 2022 what the right advice to give is for someone just starting out.

I also thought about steering them to HTML first, but I don’t think the open web as the same excitement factor for someone starting out in 2022 that it did for me back in the day (which is a shame).

What do you folks think?
stories.title: Ask HN: Which programming language for a first-time coder in 2022?
